alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Houston; Madison (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 10:33PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Burleson, northwestern Grimes, Brazos, west central Houston and Madison Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1032 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Fort Boggy State Park to 12 miles north of Caldwell. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northwestern College Station, Bryan, Madisonville, Kurten, Wixon Valley, Kyle Field, Bryan Utilities Lake, Normangee, Iola and North Zulch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
